Entries.default:
"Gótvadhja, newcomer!"

The woman's smile almost warms the cold air around Harbingers' Watch. A few strands of coppery hair flickers on the wind, and her robin egg-hued skin shimmers with faint iridescent freckles.
"See anything that interests?"
"Show me what you have for sale."
"Where do you get these fish? Everything's frozen."
"So what brought you down here?"
[Leave.] "Maybe another time."
"You say 'down' as if this isn't north of the White that Wends."
"This is the end of the world. The culmination of all things. The final chapter of the final book."
"Take a look for yourself!"
"The truth has been revealed. Even endings end, and you, you have brought that to us. Thank you, Duskspeaker!"
"Hello again, Duskspeaker."
"Fish for fair trade in coin or goods!"
"I trade in the harvest of the sea, always bountiful. All fresh caught - though it being so cold here, fresh stays fresher than fresh!"
"Are those bottles of ekkevít?" Ydwin cranes her neck, peering into the goods piled about the vendor.
"Indeed, sister! In trade from Nyvardir across the way. He's got rymsjódda, too, if you'd prefer. I've only the fish, though."
"Well then, we'll have to speak with Nyvardir, whatever else we accomplish here." Her lips turn down at the corners.
"Gótvadhja, newcomer." She bows her head slightly in greeting.
Ishiza hops closer and stares at the fish with desperate longing.
"We have plenty of food back on the boat. Down boy."
"It is not ice all the way down, newcomer!"
"They may come out a bit hard and cold, but for that we have the fire, ja?"
"This fool for one. I left the Land due to exactly this manner of nonsense. Our people have likely been chanting about the coming of the final winter for ten thousand years."
"Likely,' feh! You are like Vailians. You believe what you choose to believe. No eyes for seeing that before you!"
"You speak of evidence? Our elders hide our writing. They keep us illiterate. Ask yourself why, sister!"
"What fool would not want to be here?"
"Who hides what writing?"
"My friend has a point. The only ending offered by this place is a return to the Wheel."
"Let's keep things civil, Ydwin. Everyone's entitled to their beliefs."
[Say nothing.]
"She speaks of the sacred word signs used by our priests to keep our lore. She should know better than to do so."
"It is called jommydra and is mystified only by the secrecy in which it's kept."

"They are not. Rationale must bolster beliefs, or they are naught but castles built of mist on the surface of the sea."

She sighs and waves away her own words.
"But civil I shall remain. I've too few words to waste them on the obstinate."
"You know not the meaning of this place. You will, though. Everyone will."
Pinching the bridge of her nose, Ydwin sighs.
"That was hardly the first time I've dealt with a dragon. It proves nothing."
"Finally the recognition my troublemaking deserves."
"Yes, I am the destroyer. The very hungry destroyer. Feed me fish."
"I'm only here for the fish."
"Oh... of - of course!" She selects a few fat fish and furnishes them to you.
"Long have we waited. Know that your coming is appreciated."
"That you find it common only adds to the telling! But you came for fish, no?"

"Well, it proves that some of us lost any sense of self-preservation around the time we joined you. Funny how that goes." 

Edér puffs on his pipe thoughtfully.
"Leave me alone, will you?"
"Such glory..."
